The idea is to include the remaining balance after each transaction, in smaller font just below each debit and credit amount, in the “Recent Transactions” tab. This solves the problem of not knowing how much money the user had/has before/after a transaction. It will be easy to track the money flow, if the change in balance or change in the base amount is displayed after every transaction. I always have to scroll down and make a particular transaction as a base point and compare it to my current bal. to see how much is the net expenditure after that base transaction. The idea of tags can be implemented, but the idea which I have suggested in my original argument, this feature is more fundamental and more like a must-have feture which already exists in many bank applications like YONO (by SBI), and ICICI Mobile, etc. Please find a screenshot attached below, to better understand my idea. Screenshot_20230313_100052_YONO SBI1080×2400 153 KB You can see that after each transaction, the balance is displayed on the bottom right of each transaction tile. This feature can make it’s way to Jupiter on the “All Transactions” page which can be accessed by tapping on the “See All” button present at the bottom of “Recent Transactions” drop down menu on Home Page

Hi everyone! We wanted to share an early update for a feature we’ve started to rollout & you might see it in the app soon Remember last night’s pizza order? Or your morning auto ride? Or the outfit you ordered. While you thought of them as plain, simple payments, did you ever think they could also help build your financial future? Well, with our newest feature, they can! 31080×1080 86.1 KB Now automatically invest ₹10 or more with every payment you make! So every time you spend, you can invest ₹10 or more in a Mutual Fund. It’s fully automatic and works in the background, while you go about spending as usual. For example, if you spend ₹500 on Swiggy, a minimum of ₹10 goes to a Mutual fund of your choice. And you can set a monthly upper limit to be invested. That means if you want, you can invest only up to ₹1500 in a month. Here’s more Q. What can a ₹10 investment even do? Even these seemingly small amounts add up over time, thanks to the power of compounding. Imagine the magic of having your daily chai contribute to your dream vacation or retirement fund! Q. Is it completely automatic? Yes, it is completely automatic. Now you don’t need to remember deadlines or manually transfer funds. This feature takes care of the investing, so you can focus on enjoying life. Q. Will Jupiter pick a fund for me? You can choose the Mutual Funds of your choice! What does it look like? Here are some sneak peeks. Note: These are subject to change. You will be seeing this pop-up if you were to make a payment. Here’s a snap of the UPI payment success screen. image720×1720 54.2 KB Once you click on it, you will see the following: IMG_22321170×2532 88.1 KB Once you get started, you will have the option to edit. IMG_22331170×2532 104 KB You can confirm and edit your investment settings, shown below: IMG_22891170×2532 114 KB See how it works IMG_22911170×2532 295 KB Rollout plan The team would like to invite a few community folks to our Bangalore HQ for early in-person product testing. Bangalore HQ early access We plan to keep this on Friday, 23 Feb, 5:30pm - 6:30pm for Bangalore folks only! If you’re interested in joining us, vote below! I’m interested! I’ll wait for the full release 28 voters Votes are public. Results We’ll reach out to the ones who are interested in joining us at the HQ. All user rollout We’ve started rolling it out and it should reach you soon in a few weeks. What are your thoughts? Start transforming your spending into smart investments. Remember, small changes can lead to big results, and with this feature, every purchase becomes a step toward your financial dreams! Share your thoughts on the feature in the comments below! We’re looking forward to meeting & testing with our members

Hello everyone! After multiple requests from our members, we finally decided to have a chat feature for our Community! Chat1080×1080 34 KB What is it? Soon, our members will have access to chat casually with other members and have private conversations with others in a seamless way. Currently, to converse with others, we have: Ability to post comments under a thread Ability to make threads Ability to chat privately (DM) Coming soon: Ability to join a channel separately and chat like WhatsApp/Slack/Discord, etc Here’s what it would look like: Icon placement: Top right Chat overview Overview786×1050 48.6 KB Private chat/channel view window786×1042 31.7 KB While the team was testing this, we noticed it can be enabled for a group/certain set of users. We wanted to know who to enable this feature for since we’ll be using it in the end. Community Champs - Special privilege Only for Active members - level (3&4) Opt in basis via Group All users? Would be spammy. 28 voters Results Note: We can limit the notifications to mention only. So you won’t get spammed if you’re not online. We can create multiple channels but the access for all the channels will be based on who can see them (Based on the poll above) You can join multiple channels and leave them at any point of time. However, once you leave, you cannot rejoin them. This can be fixed by asking any admin/mods. We can add any member to the channels. Does it affect leaderboard points? We’re not sure yet. Though, we’d like your help in order to test this theory. We think chatting in channels might not contribute to the leaderboard. Overall, the chat system is pretty clean and fun. It could replace our direct message system since it’s like a thousand clicks away How we could use this? For direct chat (1on1) Casual chats that aren’t relevant to the thread topic (Avoids spam) Let us know your thoughts on this. Based on everyone’s decision, we’ll make it happen. Have a great weekend, friends. Have fun

Hello Community! We’re back with our monthly updates for December’23 For this edition, we will have revamps, additional features, and some exciting news for everyone 1. Revamped home page! IMG_18911170×2532 143 KB The team is currently working on a new UI for our home page. It has a stacked card style. You don’t have to swipe horizontally anymore. The Credit Card and Loans tab can be accessed with a single tap. If you have the new UI, what’s your experience like compared to the older one? let us know in the comments below You can vote for which UI you like better. I prefer the card stack UI I prefer the tabs to be on top separately 69 voters Votes are public. Results Last week, we rolled it out to 50% of the users and it will reach most of you soon 2. Did someone say Widgets? It’s probably a dream come true for some of you so its finally here! We’ve seen requests by a few members for a widget. Screenshot 2023-12-14 at 11.50.01 AM1004×164 17.2 KB Screenshot 2023-12-14 at 11.50.21 AM1084×190 32.7 KB Screenshot 2023-12-14 at 11.50.43 AM1450×242 45.8 KB And so… here’s how it would look like: Example of the Widget on an Android phone: Frame 11712769721440×3200 334 KB It’s live on Android and should be available for most users. If you don’t have this option yet, it should reach you soon For iOS folks, we’ll need to wait a bit. (Cries in iPhone ) Here are other design variations we worked on, like any? Let us know in the comments below which one you like the best! 3. On-Demand Salary is now Mini Loans! Last week,  shared an update on what Mini Loans was all about. Mini Loans1588×1080 162 KB Long story short, We had to give a new identity to our On-Demand Salary feature. For more context, check out the thread if you haven’t yet - 🔔 Mini Update: On-Demand Salary is now called Mini Loan 4. Meeting virtually! Our Brand and creative team wanted to chat with a few community members virtually and talk about what’s it like using Jupiter. But! they’re a little picky If you’re above 25yrs and have been using Jupiter in the past 6-12 months, this is your chance to meet the people behind all things visuals and creativity. Please tell them you need dark mode So who’s in? Please drop your vote below: Yes, I’m in! I’m a new user 48 voters Votes are public. Results Once you’ve voted, we’ll reach out to a few and decide on a time and date for Gmeet/Zoom. Looking forward! 5. Edge RuPay Credit Card when? We’ve been rolling out to our users in phases and we’re almost there to launch it for everybody! We’ll be sharing some good news in the coming days Some of our members have already received the card and shared snaps of the kit and the card Screenshot 2023-12-14 at 12.15.27 PM924×1190 62.8 KB Screenshot 2023-12-14 at 12.16.51 PM824×1012 59.1 KB Thank you all once again for your support and for pushing the team in the journey And the year is ending, there are 17 days remaining until 2024! Hello! Have you ever heard of Debit card skins? They’re like stickers for your card. There were some discussions internally about having one but, we’re still thinking about it Introducing-41080×1080 109 KB We wanted to hear the community’s thoughts about these as well. Do you own or used one before? If you haven’t seen any Debit card skins, here are some examples: 1569×569 24.4 KB Screenshot 2022-11-22 at 3.08.51 PM852×566 32 KB They come in 2 types. Covers the whole card, like shown above or, Covers everything else except the numbers and info, for example below. Screenshot_2022-11-08-16-55-16-50_1c337646f29875672b5a61192b9010f91080×733 44.7 KB Some thoughts: It’s better to have a full cover in our case since the space fire debit card is blank in the front and the numbers are behind. We also think keeping the OG spacefire colour is needed since that’s what we started with and that’s how our users remember us. In this case, would it be better to keep translucent skin instead? We wanted to keep this for special users. Community folks maybe? For example, gift box wraps. Some come in a faded translucent type with few patterns. But you can still see what’s underneath. Also, here’s a similar concept shared by  NFC enabled stickers for phones Features Jupiter should have this feature(Not sure if it can be implemented ) . A sticker that can be pasted anywhere like phones / watches, which has nfc support . My phone doesnt support tap and pay. If this was an option I would certainly buy the sticker. To me it makes more sense than carrying a debit card [image] Share your thoughts below

Whenever I see the text “up to X”, I know that I’d almost never get X. It’s always going to 25% or 30% of X. Edge Rupay’s cashback is no different. I received my Edge Rupay credit card yesterday. I used this card for making 2 payments. For a payment of ₹812, I was given 41 jewels (reward rate of 1%). For my next payment of ₹50, I was given 1 jewel (reward rate of 0.4%). image1080×952 57.5 KB This is clearly a lower reward rate than what Kiwi offers me: flat 1%. But Jupiter is better in one way: Kiwi’s rewards are for multiples of ₹50. In the extreme case, if I spend ₹99, I’ll get only ₹0.50 cashback—1% of ₹50. But Jupiter will give me jewels for the entire ₹99

Hey folks! Shriram here from the Jupiter Account Services team! We’re launching a much awaited feature - ‘Digital Cancelled Cheque’! ## What’s new: You can now download a PDF version of a Cancelled Cheque from the Jupiter app You can share this Digital Cancelled Cheque when asked to verify your account details, be it for opening a demat account, for getting a loan, or while applying for an insurance policy The format of the Digital Cancelled Cheque is based on the cheque issued by our partner bank, along with the cancellation marks image510×1046 69.1 KB ## How can you get your Digital Cancelled Cheque? You can go to the ‘Your profile’ section on the Jupiter app (by clicking on the hamburger menu on the top right of the home page) Go to Account Services Click on Digital Cancelled Cheque Click on ‘Download PDF’ to get your Digital Cancelled Cheque This should now be available to some community users. The rest will be getting access to this next week onwards. Test it out, share your feedback with us here. Thanks all

Just because February has fewer days doesn’t mean there should be fewer ways to indulge. Here’s what has been cooking at Jupiter This month is all about love. Keep the celebration going with up to 25% savings on gifts, dining, travel, and more. Whether you treat yourself or someone special, the perfect surprise still awaits you! Check it out  v3.1.7 We’ve also just released v3.1.7, focusing on key fixes and add-ons that elevate the user experience. banner1920×1080 97.6 KB Listing a few of them : RuPay Credit Card experience: We noticed our users found it hard to view their linked Rupay Credit Cards. We introduced a widget on the home screen, where you can now see all your linked RuPay Credit Cards. We’ve also provided quick access to Linked RuPay Credit Card controls. User delight: Jupiter now wishes you on your birthday! We don’t forget. You can now find a happy birthday note on the home page A lot of other small fixes to improve the overall customer experience, including: Improved FAQs & Chat Enhancements in Money view Improvements in insurance attached with loans Communication address process changes & many more Here’s what you can expect in the coming weeks: Mutual Funds baskets Investing made simple. No more overthinking. Soon, you don’t have to worry about picking the right mutual funds. Your money is automatically diversified across small-cap, mid-cap, large-cap, debt, and gold funds. Just start with an initial amount and let your wealth grow. Tried the latest update? We’d like to know your thoughts on the upcoming features and focus areas we should be working on. LWJ-intro812×866 223 KB LWJ744×664 59.5 KB This could be helpful for those of you who are already investing too! It is live for all users. What is Jupiter wrapped? It’s a personalised insights breakdown of how you performed on the Jupiter app. It’s also a way to gauge how you’re doing financially Some stats we’re thinking of (WIP) Days since you’ve been a Jupiter user + number of accounts connected Transactions done on Jupiter this year and peak month of transactions Top spend categories, merchants, etc And much more! Eg: I’d like to know how many goals i’ve completed from my pots in 2023. Please name them in the comments below. Add some fun stuff too! Hi everyone! We’re live with our first Money Situations task on our Community today! If you’re still wondering what this is, here’s the introduction for the series - Introducing Money situations series! News from Jupiter Hello Community! Hope everyone is doing well Just wanted to talk about a thought around how we interact with money in our daily lives. [Banner] Money makes the world go round, and let’s be honest, it can also cause stress and awkward silence Whether you’re struggling to make ends meet, navigating student loans, or planning for retirement, money is a deeply personal topic that often feels off-limits in conversation. But here’s the thing: money doesn’t have to… So let’s start. Situation for the week Let’s assume it’s been a tiring day at work and you and your friends planned to have a dinner party. It continues for hours and seems to be a lot of fun! Folks ordered a lot of food & drinks and no one was keeping track of the bill. After some time, you call for the waiter and the bill arrives The bill amounts to Rs. 7000 and 4 friends are involved, including yourself. Things to consider - All you had was 1 salad and maybe a coke. Not much. It’s time to pay up but you are thinking about splitting the bill equally or step up and tell your friends about how much you had to pay. Or maybe, another alternative to this? Your choices You will need to pick 1 of the below choices: I will split the bill equally I will only pay for my share Ask someone to pay for my share & pay later Something else? Absolutely! Here’s a breakdown of how Jupiter could improve its UPI app experience, focusing on dedicated offers and cashback, and how to frame these suggestions as requests to Jupiter: I. Enhancing Offers and Cashback within Jupiter UPI Dedicated “Offers & Rewards” Section: Instead of burying offers within transaction history or relying on push notifications, create a prominent “Offers & Rewards” section within the UPI app. This section should be visually appealing, easy to navigate, and clearly categorize offers. Personalized Offers: Leverage Jupiter’s data analysis to provide personalized offers based on user transaction patterns. For example: Frequent grocery shoppers get cashback on supermarket UPI transactions. Users who often pay for food delivery get discounts on partner restaurants. Utilize user location data to provide local merchant offers. Tiered Cashback/Rewards System: Implement a tiered system where users earn more rewards based on their UPI transaction volume or frequency. This could include: Base cashback on all UPI transactions. Bonus cashback for hitting monthly transaction goals. Exclusive offers for high-volume users. Partner Merchant Offers: Forge partnerships with popular online and offline merchants to offer exclusive UPI cashback and discounts. Promote these partnerships prominently within the “Offers & Rewards” section. Gamification: Introduce gamified elements like: “Streaks” for consecutive daily UPI transactions. “Challenges” to earn bonus rewards. “Spin the wheel” or scratch card options for random rewards. Clear and Transparent Cashback Tracking: Provide a clear and real-time view of earned cashback and rewards within the app. Ensure easy redemption of cashback to the user’s Jupiter account. Inform the user of expiring offer and cashback. II. Framing Requests to Jupiter Here’s how you can phrase your suggestions as constructive requests to Jupiter: Subject: Enhancing Jupiter UPI with a Dedicated Offers & Rewards Section Body: “Dear Jupiter Team, I’m a loyal Jupiter user and I appreciate the convenience of your UPI feature. To further enhance the user experience, I’d like to suggest the implementation of a dedicated ‘Offers & Rewards’ section within the Jupiter UPI app.” “This section could feature personalized offers, partner merchant discounts, and a tiered cashback system, making it more engaging for users.” “Specifically, I would like to request that you consider the following:” “Creating a visually appealing ‘Offers & Rewards’ tab.” “Implementing personalized offers based on transaction history and location.” “Developing a tiered cashback system to incentivize frequent UPI usage.” “Partnering with popular merchants to provide exclusive UPI offers.” “Adding gamification elements to make rewards more engaging.” “Providing clear and transparent cashback tracking and redemption.” “Adding a system that notifies users of expiring offers and cashback.” “I believe these improvements would significantly increase user engagement and make Jupiter UPI an even more valuable tool. Thank you for your consideration

Hi everyone! At Jupiter, we’re gearing up to launch a variety of insurance plans this year — and we want you to help shape what they look like! Why is this needed? Insurance is often seen as complex, boring, or disconnected from everyday needs. We’re trying to change that by offering simple, relevant, and value-packed plans that actually make sense for your life. Our goal: We would like to understand: Current behaviors, identify gaps, and explore how we can make insurance both useful and rewarding for you. Your experience with insurance products previously. Share your likes and dislikes and opinions in the thread below. Some ideas Some of our team members were brainstorming the other day, and we came up with some ideas. Jotting down some of them here: Transaction Fraud Protection Plan ₹499/year | Covers up to ₹1L Protection against phishing, unauthorised transactions, ATM transactions, device theft/loss, free driver’s licence, and PAN replacement. You can purchase this plan for yourself or for anyone else, like your parents, who might be more prone to clicking on random links, etc. Do you want freebies? If yes, what would you prefer? Some options: OTT subscriptions like Sony LIV and Amazon Prime for a year Built into your insurance — at no extra cost! We would love to hear from you: If you were to opt for an insurance plan, what kind of freebies or bundled perks would you genuinely find useful? OTT subscriptions YouTube Premium / Spotify Premium Swiggy One, Zomato Gold Brand vouchers / Discount codes Free health checkups 55 voters Choose up to 2 options. Votes are public. Vote now! Results Freebie suggestions! If you have any other freebie suggestions, let us know in the thread below! We want to know your favourite ones Let us know what resonates — your vote and thoughts will help us build insurance products for Jupiter

Store and access digital receipts for purchases made with the debit card directly within the mobile banking app, making it easy to track and manage expenses. 1 Automatic Receipt Capture: When a user makes a purchase using their debit card, the mobile banking app can automatically capture and retrieve relevant transaction details. 2 Receipt Storage : The app securely stores the digital receipt within the user’s account, associating it with the corresponding transaction. 3 Transaction Details : The digital receipt provides a comprehensive overview of the transaction. *Including the merchant name, transaction date and time, location, items purchased, and the total amount. 4 Instant access : Users can conveniently view and access their digital receipts directly within the mobile banking app. 5 Receipt Sharing : Users can share digital receipts with others. Digital receipts are stored securely within the mobile banking app. The receipt can be accessed at any time from the transaction history or a dedicated receipt section in the app

Hi guys! Quick intro - I lead the debit card business at Jupiter and we are currently racking your brains to figure how to pack more goodness into the card! One of the things we are considering is: INSURANCE! Yes most cards in the market come with some kind of insurance but we want to make sure that we add something that is actually useful to the user. Now, if I were to ask folks which insurance they would like - the most common answer would be health insurance or mobile insurance! But honestly, these are QUITE expensive to be given as a free add-on To give you an idea, a decent health cover can cost more than 10-15k annually, depending on your age and type of coverage. But we still want to give you something that is actually beneficial to you and adds value to your financial and personal life! So how about hospitalization coverage against accidents? If you ever have any kind of accident and need hospitalisation due to that, your cost of medical treatment would be covered upto the sum insured. So you can have the peace of mind to not worry about sudden expenses and cash crunch in an emergency! The only caveat for availing this insurance is that you should have used your debit card at least once in the last 30 days. That’s all! Do hit one of the options below to let us know if you’d like this feature on your card and drop any other ideas/ thoughts in comments! The availability of Equated Monthly Installment (EMI) schemes has made purchasing high-value items much more convenient for customers. EMI schemes allow customers to pay for the product over an extended period of time, rather than paying the full amount upfront. However, this convenience can also lead to impulsive buying behavior, where customers make purchases without fully considering the financial impact of the EMI payments. Participants in the thread share their personal experiences with EMI schemes and impulsive buying behaviour and provide tips for avoiding impulsive purchases. The discussion highlights the need for customers to be mindful of their spending habits and to make informed decisions when considering EMI schemes. What is EMI? To attract more customers and increase sales, merchant outlets and credit card companies in India offer Equated Monthly Installment (EMI) payment schemes. This is particularly helpful for customers who may not have the immediate funds to make a purchase but can afford to pay in instalments over a period of time. EMI is a popular payment option for electronic appliances, mobiles, laptops, and other gadgets, where customers can buy the product and start using it immediately while paying for it in smaller instalments spread over a longer duration. EMI stands for Equated Monthly Installment. It is a fixed amount of money that a borrower pays to a lender on a monthly basis, usually for a loan or credit card payment. The EMI includes both the principal amount and the interest charged on the loan. EMI is commonly used for payments related to loans for personal expenses, education, vehicles, homes, and other assets. What is Impulsive Buying? Impulsive buying is the act of making a purchase without prior planning or consideration, often based on emotions, desires, or immediate needs rather than careful evaluation of the product or service. Impulsive buyers tend to make quick purchasing decisions without fully considering the long-term consequences or benefits of the purchase. This behavior is often driven by factors such as advertisements, peer pressure, discounts, and emotions like excitement or stress. Impulsive buying can lead to overspending, financial stress, and buyer’s remorse, particularly when the purchased item turns out to be unnecessary or of low quality. So here are some of the questions for the community friends: Have you ever made a purchase using an EMI scheme? If so, What was the first product you purchased on EMI? Which EMI plan do you prefer the most (3 months, 6 months etc etc…24 months)? Have you ever faced any difficulties after purchasing for friends or family members using EMI? (like missed payments) In your opinion, does the availability of EMI options lead to impulsive buying behaviour? Hi Community, We’ve been working on revamping the investments dashboard and are happy to introduce the - Investment tab 2.0 It’s our latest investment home screen. This is available to all  users. 2.01080×1080 85 KB 1606×1304 85.9 KB 2604×1298 74.6 KB What's new? Easy product discovery: You will be able to easily discover the product offering on the Investment home page and quickly navigate through MF Explore, Gold, and FD. Total current value across investment products: You will be able to view the total current value on the investment Home page. The total current value will be the summation of the current values of Mutual Funds, Gold, and FD. Critical updates and actions: You will be able to quickly see the updates and action information on the Investment Home page. Why the change? Monotonous: Investment home page was monotonous - it seemed like a mutual fund explore page rather than an Investment Home page. Product discovery: The discovery of FD and Digital gold was limited to spotlight cards. How to get started? Just download app version >= 2.0.15 or update the app to the latest version. Most Wanted from Banks: I want my bank to fight for me and have my back when I encounter issues such as refund problems , poor product/service quality , or online fraud . It’s frustrating and time-consuming to deal with merchants on my own. The bank should at least send an email to the merchant regarding my issue and have customer support guide me through these situations. In the past, when I was a victim of online fraud , the bank didn’t help me much . They just told me to file a FIR and fill out a form in person , but didn’t mention the option of registering a complaint on the cyber department’s website , informing the sender and receiver banks and platforms , or calling the cyber fraud helpline . It would also be great if banks had a blog on these topics to educate their customers and make them feel safe and secure when making purchases or sending money . I want the refund and chargeback process to be simple and have the bank’s team guide me through it. I’d even choose a bank that provides strong support over one that offers more rewards and cashbacks . This is a big problem in the banking industry today and I believe neo banks have the potential to solve it and be game-changers . However, neo banks are still dependent on their partner banks for handling transaction disputes , so there’s still a wait for that. Nonetheless, neo banks should not neglect this issue or they won’t be able to differentiate themselves from traditional banks . The big players like IDFC , AU , and Paytm Payments Bank are still in the game

It is May 4th once again, which means it’s a special day for the Jupiter Community. Question: Why is May 4th significant? Answer: It is because it’s Star Wars Day!  Fans of the Star Wars franchise celebrate “Star Wars Day” on May the 4th, which is a playful reference to the iconic phrase from the series “May the Force be with you,” often said as “May the Fourth be with you.” This day brings fans together to revel in all things Star Wars, including watching movies, donning costumes of beloved characters, and expressing their affection for the franchise on social media. The inaugural organized Star Wars Day was held in Toronto, Canada in 2011, and has since gained popularity, becoming a global celebration amongst fans. It is my hope that the community has an abundance of surprises, challenges, contests, fun activities, and other exciting events to enjoy today. I would like to dedicate this thread to one of the biggest Star Wars enthusiasts in our community, our beloved brother . Happy May the 4th! May the 4th Be With You! 1 StarWars.com Star Wars Day - StarWars.com Say “May the 4th Be With You” out loud and you’ll hear the pun that Star Wars fans worldwide have turned into a rallying cry to proclaim their love of the saga. StarWars.com May the 4th Be With You: A Cultural History The inside story of the Star Wars galaxy’s fan holiday. Why is May 4th Star Wars Day? Fourth Be With You started as pun, grew into worldwide celebration - ABC7 San Francisco

Online payment security can be considered as providing rules, regulations, and security measures to protect customers’ privacy, data, and the money involved. In this digital era, every business, company needs to look out for every hazard, every problem that can be faced through cyber attacks, as it can occur as quickly as clicking on an email link. So, what are the security protocols and processes you should look for, every time you transact online? How to defend against online breaches in online payment security? Are there any best ways to improve online security? Payment Security🔐 It is essential to create general awareness among people about online security and fraud. Precaution is always better than cure. An aware customer and equally trained employee can be considered as one of the key points to fraud minimization. In addition to the awareness within employees, a business owner should also be familiar with government schemes and regulations to prevent fraud. Two-factor authentication✅ 2FA gives a more sophisticated level of protection. This authorization is mainly used while entering an account. 2FA adds an extra layer of security that can be used to make sure that people trying to gain access to an online account are who they say they are. As the name suggests, it provides two different authentication factors to verify themselves, for example, it includes security questions, SMS messages, OTPs, pushes notifications, etc

Important alert on Tax Saving! Hey Team, This year, March 29, 30, and 31 are holidays , so the deadline to invest in tax-saving funds is March 28, 2024, till 2:00 PM. That’s right, you’ve got only TEN days left! If you invest after the deadline, your investments will be considered for tax savings in the next financial year. [Note: You got 10 days only on Jupiter, on other apps you might get 7-8 days]. If you’ve opted for the old tax regime & are earning over 5 lakh, you’ve a chance to save big on taxes . Invest up to Rs 1,50,000 in tax-saving mutual funds and slash your taxes by up to Rs 46,800 under section 80C of the Income Tax Act. For the actual savings, enter the correct details on the Tax Saving Widget on Jupiter. You can download your tax saving statement from here. Don’t let procrastination rob you of substantial savings. Invest wisely, save smartly! #TaxSaving #InvestSmart #ActNow

Hi everyone, I’m Naman, representing the Product team at Loans on Jupiter. I’m thrilled to share a mini update on our On-Demand Salary offering on Jupiter, which is getting a fresh new identity – Mini Loan Below is a quick background and why we’re changing the name ​​On-Demand Salary was initially started as an exclusive loan offering only for Salaried professionals allowing them to instantly withdraw a part of their salary based on how many days in the month they had worked. However, over the past few months, we’ve undergone substantial transformations and have started offering a much wider array of loan products. This includes extending our offerings to not just salaried individuals but also to self-employed, housewives and freelancers/professionals. As our offerings continue to evolve, we recognized the need to rebrand our product that reflects the current breadth of our services. We’re really excited about this positive shift and look forward to your continued support! The all new… ‘Mini’ loan for all your instant needs What is a Mini Loan? You can get a Mini Loan of up to ₹1,50,000 at 0% interest . Repay the loan in up to 45 days How do you get a mini loan? Ensure that you are on the latest version of the Jupiter App If you are eligible for Loans, you’ll see the Loans tab on the Jupiter App Homepage Select the type of loan that works for you - Mini Loan or Personal Loan Get money in your account instantly – no hassle of paperwork! Let us know what you think. Happy to respond to any questions you may have
